Good stuff I would say. Try to keep the insta-deaths at a minimum 
though because if computer AI is improved, say then you have an 
impossible level XX Assasin to kill, the levels could become near 
impossible. I think create blackhole should gravitate people towards 
it and hurt them at a constant rate when they approach the center. 
The assasins best attack should be poison blade which does a critical 
amount of damage to the enemy on hit and quickly reduces their hit 
points from there after (unless healed). 

Soldier should advance to either a Captian or Commander.
Basic Attack: would stay the same
1st special: Charge
2nd: Battlecry (makes surrounding troops increase speed)
3rd: Sheild (any incoming attacks from the front are blocked)
4th: Last Resort (Drains all magic and half health to heal and 
reenergize all surrounding troops)

Archer Changes to Ranger
Same basic attack
1st: fire arrow
2nd: Chamealon (invisible until Ranger moves)
3rd: Woodswalk (much like elves but drains magic faster and cannot 
fire from forest)
4th: Called Shot (Arrow hits nearest enemy and does massive damage)

> Yea, this week, we are talking about new classes that are 
promotions 
> of existing classes as well as continuing the discussion on any 
> character classes.  Let's here those new ideas.
> 
> I would bring back the idea of a couple of promoted characters:
> 
> 1)practical mage - same basic attack A mage,
> with teleport and leave teleport marker as 1st attack
> with stop time and slow down time as 2nd attack
> teleport teammates and teleport opponents as 3rd attack
> create teleporter and create blackhole (anything steps inside is 
> killed) as 4th attack.
> 
> The blackhole would be one of the most powerfull attacks.
> 
> 2)High priest, same basic type as cleric,
> 1st attack = heal/mystic mace
> 2nd attack = wide area heal/greater heal (heal beyond 100% health)
> 3rd attack = summon curse/undo curse (random selection of which 
curse 
> is applied from many choices)
> 4th attack = resurrect character / reincarinate character
